gobblin.util

Class WriterUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.util.WriterUtils

  • public class WriterUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for use with the DataWriter class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  WriterUtils.WriterFilePathType
      TABLENAME should be used for jobs that pull from multiple tables/topics and intend to write the records in each table/topic to a separate folder.

    • Method Detail

      • getWriterStagingDir

        public static org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path getWriterStagingDir(gobblin.configuration.State state,
                                                            int numBranches,
                                                            int branchId)
        Get the Path corresponding the to the directory a given DataWriter should be writing its staging data. The staging data directory is determined by combining the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_STAGING_DIR and the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_PATH.
        Parameters:
        state - is the State corresponding to a specific DataWriter.
        numBranches - is the total number of branches for the given State.
        branchId - is the id for the specific branch that the DataWriter will write to.
        Returns:
        a Path specifying the directory where the DataWriter will write to.

      • getWriterOutputDir

        public static org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path getWriterOutputDir(gobblin.configuration.State state,
                                                           int numBranches,
                                                           int branchId)
        Get the Path corresponding the to the directory a given DataWriter should be writing its output data. The output data directory is determined by combining the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_OUTPUT_DIR and the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_PATH.
        Parameters:
        state - is the State corresponding to a specific DataWriter.
        numBranches - is the total number of branches for the given State.
        branchId - is the id for the specific branch that the DataWriter will write to.
        Returns:
        a Path specifying the directory where the DataWriter will write to.

      • getDataPublisherFinalDir

        public static org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path getDataPublisherFinalDir(gobblin.configuration.State state,
                                                                 int numBranches,
                                                                 int branchId)
        Get the Path corresponding the to the directory a given gobblin.publisher.BaseDataPublisher should commits its output data. The final output data directory is determined by combining the ConfigurationKeys.DATA_PUBLISHER_FINAL_DIR and the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_PATH.
        Parameters:
        state - is the State corresponding to a specific DataWriter.
        numBranches - is the total number of branches for the given State.
        branchId - is the id for the specific branch that the gobblin.publisher.BaseDataPublisher will publish.
        Returns:
        a Path specifying the directory where the gobblin.publisher.BaseDataPublisher will publish.

      • getWriterFilePath

        public static org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path getWriterFilePath(gobblin.configuration.State state,
                                                          int numBranches,
                                                          int branchId)
        Get the Path corresponding the the relative file path for a given DataWriter. This method retrieves the value of ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_PATH from the given State. It also constructs the default value of the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_PATH if not is not specified in the given State.
        Parameters:
        state - is the State corresponding to a specific DataWriter.
        numBranches - is the total number of branches for the given State.
        branchId - is the id for the specific branch that the {DataWriter will write to.
        Returns:
        a Path specifying the relative directory where the DataWriter will write to.

      • getTableNameWriterFilePath

        public static org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path getTableNameWriterFilePath(gobblin.configuration.State state)
        Creates Path for the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_PATH key according to ConfigurationKeys.EXTRACT_TABLE_NAME_KEY.
        Parameters:
        state -
        Returns:

      • getDefaultWriterFilePath

        public static org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path getDefaultWriterFilePath(gobblin.configuration.State state,
                                                                 int numBranches,
                                                                 int branchId)
        Creates the default Path for the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_PATH key.
        Parameters:
        numBranches - is the total number of branches for the given State.
        branchId - is the id for the specific branch that the DataWriter will write to.
        Returns:
        a Path specifying the directory where the DataWriter will write to.

      • getWriterFileName

        public static java.lang.String getWriterFileName(gobblin.configuration.State state,
                                                 int numBranches,
                                                 int branchId,
                                                 java.lang.String writerId,
                                                 java.lang.String formatExtension)
        Get the value of ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_NAME for the a given DataWriter. The method also constructs the default value of the ConfigurationKeys.WRITER_FILE_NAME if it is not set in the State
        Parameters:
        state - is the State corresponding to a specific DataWriter.
        numBranches - is the total number of branches for the given State.
        branchId - is the id for the specific branch that the {DataWriter will write to.
        writerId - is the id for a specific DataWriter.
        formatExtension - is the format extension for the file (e.g. ".avro").
        Returns:
        a String representation of the file name.

      • getCodecFactory

        public static org.apache.avro.file.CodecFactory getCodecFactory(com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.String> codecName,
                                                                com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.String> deflateLevel)
        Creates a CodecFactory based on the specified codec name and deflate level. If codecName is absent, then a CodecFactory.deflateCodec(int) is returned. Otherwise the codecName is converted into a CodecFactory via the CodecFactory.fromString(String) method.
        Parameters:
        codecName - the name of the codec to use (e.g. deflate, snappy, xz, etc.).
        deflateLevel - must be an integer from [0-9], and is only applicable if the codecName is "deflate".
        Returns:
        a CodecFactory.

      • mkdirsWithRecursivePermission

        public static void mkdirsWithRecursivePermission(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem fs,
                                                 org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path,
                                                 org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.FsPermission perm)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Create the given dir as well as all missing ancestor dirs. All created dirs will have the given permission. This should be used instead of FileSystem.mkdirs(Path, FsPermission), since that method only sets the permission for the given dir, and not recursively for the ancestor dirs.
        Parameters:
        fs - FileSystem
        path - The dir to be created
        perm - The permission to be set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if failing to create dir or set permission.

                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
